snippet: Growing calls for a woman to lead the United Nations reflect not only an appeal for gender equity but also frustration with the opaque way in which world powers bargain over the appointment.
abstract: Three dozen countries, led by Colombia, are pushing to have a woman appointed as next Secretary General of United Nations; women's groups and leaders from around world are supporting the suggestion, citing fact that since its inception 45 years ago, UN has been led by succession of men.
lead_paragraph: Growing calls for a woman to lead the United Nations reflect not only an appeal for gender equity but also frustration with the opaque way in which world powers bargain over the appointment.

headline.main: After 70 Years of Men, Some Say It Is ‘High Time’ a Woman Led the U.N.
headline.print_headline: After 70 Years of Men, Some Say It’s ‘High Time’ a Woman Led the U.N.
